text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: You don’t find the happy life. You make it.
author: Camilla Eyring Kimball

text: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Ram Dass

text: I am not lazy. I am on energy-saving mode.
author: Unknown

text: Life is short. Smile while you still have teeth.
author: Unknown

text: My bed and I love each other, but the alarm clock keeps trying to break us up.
author: Unknown

text: I'm not arguing, I'm just explaining why I'm right.
author: Unknown

text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Unknown

text: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Little by little, one travels far.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.
author: Alan Watts

text: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

text: We are most alive when we're in love.
author: John Updike

text: In the end, we discover that to love and let go can be the same thing.
author: Jack Kornfield

text: Stay hungry. Stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde
